page.title: 08ECOLOGY IN AYLESBURY
page.content: Rare plants and animals in Aylesbury are few but there is much variety. {Wildlife} has not been greatly affected by building programmes although a new ringroad threatens a small section of wetland. The council sends details of planning applications to Aylesbury museum which objects if the construction will affect important wildlife. Because the countryside is so close to Aylesbury, conservation is usually concentrated outside the town and the public has only begun to conserve wildlife here during the past 5 years. Areas of wildlife which have been ruined are being balanced by numerous people {creating ponds} and growing plants in their {gardens} which attract wildlife. The {canal}, {railway} embankments and sewage works are renowned for the wildlife found there.
